configurations.list.column.name: Name of configuration
creation.datasetSelection.callout: Select the lists that will be used for this continuous screening. You will receive alerts every time a new entry on those lists, matches the profile of an actively monitored entity in Marble.
creation.datasetSelection.list.title: Lists
creation.modal.title: New continuous screening
creation.objectMapping.callout: Configure which type(s) of objects you want to monitor, what type of entities they should be searched as, and map their fields to standard data list fields.
creation.objectMapping.configurator.fiel: Select which field of the Marble object (on the left, as configured in the data model) maps to which standard field from the data lists (on the right). Fields that are already used in another screening configuration cannot be modified. Several Marble fields may map to the same data list field.
creation.objectMapping.configurator.ftmE: Select an entity type. Objects you send for screening will be searched in the lists as this type. For example, if you choose 'Person', every object you send will be searched among all physical persons in the data lists.
creation.objectMapping.configurator.tabl: Select a table from your data model that you want to monitor
creation.scoringConfiguration.alertAutom: All alerts for screenings hits to review will be automatically added to a case in this inbox.
creation.scoringConfiguration.callout: In this section, you will configure the parameters that determine matching precision. These are the main parameters to tune to increase detection sensitivity or reduce false positives.
creation.scoringConfiguration.matchLimit: The recommended range for this parameter is between 5 and 20.
A lower number makes for faster searches, but may miss legitimate matches.
Maximum number of hits to consider
creation.scoringConfiguration.matchThres: A score too low (< 60%) is likely to generate a lot of false positives. A score too high (> 90%) may miss legitimate matches.
Matches with a score below this value will not be returned.
creation.scoringConfiguration.recap.matc: Maximum number of hits to return: {{limit}}
creation.title: New: {{name}}
edition.validation.generalInfo.title: General information
edition.validation.objectMapping.title: Object mapping
edition.validation.title: Confirmation of configuration edition
edition.validation.validation_callout: Please review the changes you made to the configuration. You will be able to change them again later.
field.description.label: Description
field.inbox.label: Inbox
field.name.label: Name
review.callout.dataset_updated: A <EntityType/> object has been added or modified in a regulatory list, and one or more possible matches have been found in your data under continuous screening.
review.callout.object_added: A new <EntityType/> object has been added to the continuous screening, and some possible matches have been found in the monitored datasets.
review.callout.object_updated: An <EntityType/> object under continuous screening has been updated, and some new possible matches have been found in the monitored datasets.
review.dismiss_alert_modal.confirmation_: Are you sure you want to force the resolution?
review.dismiss_alert_modal.partial_searc: The search results are partial, meaning there are still matches above the search threshold. These matches will also be ignored if you force the resolution of the alert.
review.dismiss_alert_modal.warning_text: Dismissing all matches will force the resolution of the alert. All remaining matches will be marked as ignored. This action is only available to administrators.
review.entity_details.title: Entity details
review.matches.title: Matches to review
view.datasetSelection.callout: CHANGEME Select the lists that will be used for this continuous screening. You will receive alerts every time a new entry on those lists, matches the profile of an actively monitored entity in Marble.
view.datasetSelection.list.title: CHANGEME Lists
view.objectMapping.callout: CHANGEME Configure which type(s) of objects you want to monitor, what type of entities they should be searched as, and map their fields to standard data list fields.
view.objectMapping.configurator.fieldMap: CHANGEME Select which field of the Marble object (on the left, as configured in the data model) maps to which standard field from the data lists (on the right). Fields that are already used in another screening configuration cannot be modified. Several Marble fields may map to the same data list field.
view.objectMapping.configurator.ftmEntit: CHANGEME Select an entity type. Objects you send for screening will be searched in the lists as this type. For example, if you choose 'Person', every object you send will be searched among all physical persons in the data lists.
view.objectMapping.configurator.tableNam: CHANGEME Select a table from your data model that you want to monitor
view.scoringConfiguration.alertAutomatio: CHANGEME or create a new inbox
CHANGEME All alerts for screenings hits to review will be automatically added to a case in this inbox.
view.scoringConfiguration.callout: CHANGEME In this section, you will configure the parameters that determine matching precision. These are the main parameters to tune to increase detection sensitivity or reduce false positives.
view.scoringConfiguration.matchLimit.cal: CHANGEME The recommended range for this parameter is between 5 and 20.
view.scoringConfiguration.matchLimit.sub: CHANGEME A lower number makes for faster searches, but may miss legitimate matches.
view.scoringConfiguration.matchLimit.tit: CHANGEME Maximum number of hits to consider
view.scoringConfiguration.matchThreshold: CHANGEME A score too low (< 60%) is likely to generate a lot of false positives. A score too high (> 90%) may miss legitimate matches.
CHANGEME Matches with a score below this value will not be returned.
